DOC.brief_summary: Lumbar zygapophyseal joint cysts can cause lower extremity radiculopathy. These cysts can be cured by a minimally invasive technique: percutaneous cyst distention and rupture
DOC.brief_title: Percutaneous Rupture of Zygapophyseal Joint Cysts
DOC.detailed_description: Lumbar zygapophyseal joint cysts can cause lower extremity radiculopathy. These cysts can be cured by a minimally invasive technique: percutaneous cyst distention and rupture. 30 patient with lower extremity radiculopathy caused by lumbar zygapophyseal joint cysts will be included in the study.
DOC.criteria: Patients with lumbar zygapophyseal joint cyst and compression of a spinal nerve root with lower extremity radiculopathy proven by MRI. Infection, uncontrollable bleeding disorder
